alert.note: Alert for Grundy; La Salle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 11:43AM CST until January 28 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at Morris affecting Grundy and La Salle Counties. Illinois River at Ottawa affecting La Salle County. For the Upper Illinois River...including Morris, Ottawa, La Salle... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Illinois River from the Kankakee River outlet at Channahon downstream to Heritage Harbor east of Ottawa, including the Morris gauge. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Pine Bluff Road is threatened west of IL-47 south of Morris. Dwight Road is threatened south of Morris. High water levels begin to impact shipping interests along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CST Saturday, the river stage was 16.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.9 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: River rises are being affected by snowmelt caused by above freezing temperatures. Changes to the temperature forecast may cause changes to the river forecast. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Report flooding to the National Weather Service or your local law enforcement agency only when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 545 AM CST.
